title: Mexican wrestler fractures his neck as he dives out of the ring to tackle his opponent
text:
A Mexican wrestler fractured his neck and was left lying on the floor after he jumped out of the ring to try and tackle an opponent.

Footage shows the Mexican AAA Worldwide wrestler Jesus Alfonso Huerta Escoboza, 53, hitting his head on a safety barrier as he dives out of the ring.

The man suffered serious injuries during a match in the 67th Anniversary of the Monterrey Coliseum, in the city of Monterrey in the Mexican state of Nuevo Leon.

Wrestler Jesus Alfonso Huerta Escoboza wanted to tackle an opponent outside the ring

Lucha Libre AAA Worldwide (AAA Worldwide Wrestling) is a wrestling promotion based in Mexico City which has a reputation for eccentric matches and characters.

The wrestler, who goes under the name 'La Parka' in the competition, was attempting to tackle an opponent outside the ring when the incident happened.

Local media report he tangled his feet on one of the ropes when he tried to jump.

When he jumped out of the ring, he missed his opponent and hit his head on a safety barrier

Footage shows the wrestler lying on the floor. He was reportedly unconscious after the impact

One video shows the moment Huerta jumps from the ring but misses his opponent as he lands head-first on a protective barrier.

A second video filmed from a different angle shows the wrestler becoming tangled in the middle rope of the ring before hitting the barrier.

'La Parka' was reportedly unconscious immediately after the impact.

Medical staff attended the scene before transporting him to hospital to keep him under observation overnight

The Mexican wrestler goes under the name 'La Parka' in the AAA Worldwide competition

Medical staff transported the wrestler to Hospital Oca where he remained under observation overnight as they waited for the swelling in his head to go down.

According to the Mexican newspaper 'La Reforma', Huerta could not move his arms or speak after the accident.

Sources close to the man said he suffered a fractured neck and cervical vertebrae.

Despite his injuries, his health is 'out of danger' as the wrestler 'slowly gains control of his extremities', according to La Reforma.

The gravity of his fractures is unclear.
